Description: Weight: ⅓ dīnār. Eight lines of Kufic inscription with star(?) at end of second line. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: Cf. Miles, G.C. 1964a. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo, 13; Launois, Aimée. 1969. Estampilles, poids, étalons monétaires et autres disques musulmans en verre. ‘Bulletin d'études orientales’ XXII, 4.

No specimen appears to have been illustrated. This specimen and that cited by Launois 1969, 4, appear to have a star at the end of the second line, specified in the case of the one published by Launois to be six-pointed. On the British Museum's piece, owing to the positioning of the die, only the blurred edge of the presumed star is visible. On the one in the Muntazah Palace collection Miles notes the omission of thāʾ in mithqāl, an error also found on the present piece.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (66)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ẓaffār b. Shabba
